channel.title: Content Management on menu
channel.description: Recent content in Content Management on menu

item.title: Code
item.description: Regular code The coolest thing (to me) about the original zdoc theme, is how the coding renders. A variety of common languages are included but not all of them. You can download more but it does bloat the site so only take the ones you think you’ll need to use. If you want to use (any) code and show it you’ll use the following template ```language line of code 1 line of code 2 line of code 3 ``` if you specify a recognzied language, the appropriate syntax highlighting is used.

item.title: Math
item.description: Within a markdown document, if you wish to enter simple math, just use code as if you were writing LaTeX code, so you can directly write 1 The equation `\(y=\alpha^2\)` is a quadratic. or 1 The equation `$y=\alpha^2$` is quadratic. for inline equations and 1 The equation \[y=\alpha^2\] is quadratic. or 1 is quadratic. $$y=\alpha^2$$ is quadratic. for standalone environments.

item.title: Section
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.
